fields_of_interest: Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: FORATOM activities are currently focusing on the following EU energy-related issues: the EU Energy Union, the New Energy Market Design, the follow-up of the Paris Agreement and the EU Emission Trading Scheme (ETS) reform. FORATOM also covers nuclear-specific issues such as the Illustrative Nuclear Programme (PINC), the revision of the Euratom Treaty – Art 41 to 44 requirements, the implementation of the radioactive waste and the nuclear safety Directives and the topics of radiation protection and emergency preparedness. It is also actively involved in the European Nuclear Energy Forum (ENEF).
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations

relevant_communication: FORATOM provides information and expertise on the role of nuclear energy. To do so, it produces position papers, newsfeeds, responses to public consultations, analyses of public opinion, infographics (http://www.foratom.org/publications.html) etc. It also organises regular networking events like dinner debates, workshops, one-on-one meetings, press  briefings,  visits  to  nuclear facilities etc.
goals__remit: FORATOM is the Brussels-based trade association for the nuclear energy industry in Europe. Its main purpose is to promote the use of nuclear energy in Europe by representing the interests of this important and multi-faceted industrial sector.
